title: Jofra Archerâ€™s return is a risk England must take with India on the march | Ali Martin
description: The fast bowler may be underdone but the national side canâ€™t afford to ignore him â€“ the question is who makes wayTradition usually dictates that after a batting lineup fails in the manner that Englandâ€™s largely did on a flat one at Edgbaston â€“ four ducks among the top six, just two men passing 50, 157.4 overs batted to Indiaâ€™s 234 â€“ a bowler or two must pay the price.Given the short turnaround, and with admittedly some merit after shipping more than 1,000 runs in a home Test for just the second time in history, this will come to pass at Lordâ€™s on Thursday. All signs point to Jofra Archerâ€™s return. A risk? Undoubtedly. After four years of injury struggles and a slow burn of a comeback in the white-ball formats, a mere 18 overs of priming in county cricket feels instinctively skinny. Continue reading...
author: Ali Martin

He also shares his thoughts on how India are managing Jasprit Bumrah's fitness after he was rested for the 2nd Test at Edgbaston.England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt tells Stumped her sideâ€™s problems with spin must be addressed as they build to this Autumnâ€™s World Cup in India and Sri Lanka.And we look at why Pakistanâ€™s men continue to struggle to find a permanent test Head Coach.

title: England vs India: Where does the India Test team go from here?
description: On this weekâ€™s Stumped with Alison Mitchell, Jim Maxwell & Charu Sharma, we hear from Indian Test Cricketer K S Bharat after India lose the opening Test of their five match series away in England.Bharat talks about what Shubman Gill is like as a captain, what it is like to keep wicket to Jasprit Bumrah and what changes India could make to their side going forward. The team also discus Australiaâ€™s tour of the West Indies, with both sides in transition they assess the changes theyâ€™re making.Plus, we reflect on the Test match retirement of Sri Lanka great Angelo Mathews.Photo: Joe Root and Jamie Smith of England celebrate after Smith hits the winning runs during day five of the first Rothesay Test Match between England and India at Headingley on June 24, 2025 in Leeds, England.
